column1: About a year after the family moved to Oklahoma
column2: Will Johnson got a neighbor boy to go with him back to their place in Texas to bring another wagon load of household goods. They were gone about two weeks.While the family was in Oklahoma
column3: Will — who was about 20 — taught school two terms at Nubbin Ridge
column6: was not about to go to school to a teacher who was his older brother
column7: so he saddled his horse and slipped away back to Melvin's ranch
column8: to be with his brother Joe. He said he got tired of riding but not nearly as tired as his horse. The journey was about 300 miles. He was on the trail three days and nights and had to stop at times to let his horse rest. When he got to the ranch
column9: Joe wrote to the family saying that Simpson was with him and for them not to worry. They had suspected where he had gone but were not sure.
